verb.description: Expel (a foreigner) from a country, typically on the grounds of illegal status or for having committed a crime.
examples: he was deported for violation of immigration laws

verb.description: Conduct oneself in a specified manner.
examples: he has deported himself with great dignity

origin: Late 16th century (in deport (sense 2)): from French déporter, from Latin deportare, from de- away + portare carry.
